answers.answer: Hi,How are you? Frequent urination may be due to underlying conditions such as diabetes, pregnancy, and prostate problems.  Other causes include: Interstitial cystitis, medicines such as diuretics, Overactive bladder syndrome,  Prostatitis, Stroke and other neurological diseases as well as  urinary incontinence.If it persists, it would be best to have this evaluated further by your doctor for proper diagnosis and management.  It is important that the underlying cause is determined for proper treatment.  LAboratory tests such as urinalysis, urine culture and sensitivity tests, Cystometry or cystoscopy. Neurological tests  and ultrasonography may also help rule out other causes.  Antibiotics and medicine may be prescribed to lessen the discomfort, if needed. Take care and regards.

question: I am 25 years  old  unmarried lady .I have recurrent Ecoli infection .Even when I do not have  Ecoli infection I have  have urine frequency for every 1hour .I have  always dihoriea .At the time of  dihoriea the solitein (urine frequency medicine )will cause dehydration? What to do for urine frequency?
title: urine frequency
